content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

12
Julia> function timezone_bumper(dt, bump=3)
           if typeof(dt) == Date
               throw(ErrorException("Date type not supported"))
           end
           return dt + Hour(bump)
       end

julia> tz = DateTime(2017, 9, 16, 5, 30, 0);  # timestamp to bump

julia> new_tz = timezone_bumper(tz);  
```
This will increase the original timestamp by +3 hours. If a `Date` type is provided instead of `DateTime`, an error will be thrown.
